page.title: 12THE BRITWELL ESTATE
page.content: The Britwell estate was built in 1957 by the GLC on what was Britwell Farm; it was later handed over to Slough Borough council.The name means bright well and it is named after one of the many springs from the gravel terraces of the river Thames, specifically the Taplow-Lynch Hill Terrace.The estate was built to rehouse people from the slum clearance areas of London and Essex.In all there are:169 Bedsit Bungalows;320 one bed flats;73 three bed flats;592 three bed houses;28 five bed houses and 20 three bed masonettes There are two shopping parades in the area,there is a secondary school;Beechwood and two primary schools;Claycotts and Lynch Hill. Originally a "lawless area"it is now well established and "privatising"
